RESPONSE TEXT: The doctor said I could say goodbye. I've decided... to have the operation. I know I'll lose all my memories. I don't want you to be sad.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I... I have nightmares. And this world, the SRB, being hunted. I just can't handle it. Everyone says I'll be safer if I start a new life. I know I'll be happier.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: The doctor said I could say goodbye. I've decided... to have the operation. I know I'll lose all my memories. I don't want you to be sad.
RESPONSE TEXT: I... I have nightmares. And this world, the SRB, being hunted. I just can't handle it. Everyone says I'll be safer if I start a new life. I know I'll be happier.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: My only regret is I'll forget... Old Man Stockton. High Rise. And you. Looking back, there's only fear. Worse than fear. But I will miss my new... friends.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I... I have nightmares. And this world, the SRB, being hunted. I just can't handle it. Everyone says I'll be safer if I start a new life. I know I'll be happier.
RESPONSE TEXT: My only regret is I'll forget... Old Man Stockton. High Rise. And you. Looking back, there's only fear. Worse than fear. But I will miss my new... friends.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: It's time, H2.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's time, H2.
RESPONSE TEXT: I... uh... Thanks.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?
RESPONSE TEXT: Synths are expected to behave... like machines. You await instructions. You execute instructions. You perform basic self-maintenance.
SCRIPT NOTES: Never had to explain something so obvious, the list is rote in his head.

RESPONSE TEXT: Anything else is considered defective. And then the SRB comes.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?
RESPONSE TEXT: They're the ones that watch us. To make sure we're not defective. To make sure we don't run.
Synths that get noticed just disappear. I don't know where they go.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?
SCRIPT NOTES: Talking about the boogey-man here, scared / Somber

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Goodbye, H2.
RESPONSE TEXT: Thank you. You have no idea how nice it is to talk to someone.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You worked with scientists?
RESPONSE TEXT: Yes. At least that's what we called them. My only interaction with them was to receive orders on what to clean.
I would acknowledge my task and occasionally ask for necessary clarification. But that's really it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?
SCRIPT NOTES: A little bleak, sorry he's not helpful

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You worked with scientists?
RESPONSE TEXT: I heard there was a Concourse above the tunnels. It's huge, big, and green. With many synths.
SCRIPT NOTES: Wracking his brain, residual confusion about the concepts of "huge" "green"

RESPONSE TEXT: But they're watched more carefully by the scientists. Mr. Stockton said very few synths from that section ever escape.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So you know where the Institute is, right?
RESPONSE TEXT: Stockton already asked me that. I don't know. I really don't. He says no synths know. How or why that is, I can't say.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?
SCRIPT NOTES: He's talking about something he is programmed not to remember. It's a difficult subject. He tries to force himself to remember and fails.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So you know where the Institute is, right?
RESPONSE TEXT: The only thing I'll say is I had help. Sorry. It's the one thing I won't talk about.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?
SCRIPT NOTES: Someone saved him from hell, he will in no way shape or form put that person in danger. So he clams up, even to someone he respects greatly.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I appreciate the thought.
RESPONSE TEXT: You guys are all... well, no one's ever stuck their neck out for me.
DIALOGUE AFTER: H222: I wanted to thank you. This world is... overwhelming. But people like you make me feel better about coming here.
SCRIPT NOTES: Overwhelmed in a thankful way / Grateful

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I eat danger for breakfast. Tastes like chicken.
RESPONSE TEXT: Chicken? I'm sorry, I don't understand. But...
DIALOGUE AFTER: H222: I wanted to thank you. This world is... overwhelming. But people like you make me feel better about coming here.
SCRIPT NOTES: Doesn't know what a chicken is. Confused / Puzzled

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Why not talk to me?
RESPONSE TEXT: I don't really know. But Mr. Stockton told me it's best for everyone. I don't think he was lying to me.
DIALOGUE AFTER: H222: I wanted to thank you. This world is... overwhelming. But people like you make me feel better about coming here.
SCRIPT NOTES: In the dark, trying to be helpful / Suspicious

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You guys are all... well, no one's ever stuck their neck out for me.
RESPONSE TEXT: I wanted to thank you. This world is... overwhelming. But people like you make me feel better about coming here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We do all of this to give you a better life.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We do all of this to give you a better life.
RESPONSE TEXT: You really. You really have no idea how much I appreciate all of this.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?
SCRIPT NOTES: Almost breaking down here, so thankful (Goodbye line) / Grateful

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Yeah, yeah. Enough of the sappiness.
RESPONSE TEXT: Of course. Well, take care.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?
SCRIPT NOTES: Awkward, doesn't want to annoy the PC

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I have a lot of questions. Especially about the Institute.
RESPONSE TEXT: That's precisely what Mr. Stockton said I shouldn't talk about. At all.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We do all of this to give you a better life.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I have a lot of questions. Especially about the Institute.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm sorry, I don't know much about the Institute. I worked the maintenance tunnels. Every day for as long as I can remember.
SCRIPT NOTES: Trying to help, knowing he's going to disappoint his hero

RESPONSE TEXT: The only time I spoke to anyone was to acknowledge scientists' orders and very rarely to other synths. I've talked more in the past few days than I have my entire life.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I have a lot of questions. Especially about the Institute.
RESPONSE TEXT: Listen, I don't want to cause any of you any more trouble than I already have. So I'll just hold my tongue. Thanks, again.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: What's life like for a synth in the Institute?
SCRIPT NOTES: Wishes he could say stuff, but can't - overflowing with thanks

RESPONSE TEXT: From what I've been told it's probably safer if I don't say anything. I don't want to put you in any more danger.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I appreciate the thought.

RESPONSE TEXT: I'm glad to be off the streets.
Is this the sort of place people live?
High Rise seems friendly.
Sorry, I'm really not used to small talk.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Nice to meet you, H2.
RESPONSE TEXT: Another person actually happy to meet me. This'll take some getting used to.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OldManStockton: Remember what I told you, H2.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: There may be more raiders out there. We should make this quick.
RESPONSE TEXT: Quick. Got it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OldManStockton: Remember what I told you, H2.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What sort of name is H2-22?
RESPONSE TEXT: It's my designation.
DIALOGUE AFTER: OldManStockton: The Institute doesn't bother to name their property. Synths are just numbers and letters to them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: HighRise: Hey you. You OK?
RESPONSE TEXT: A little rattled. But I've never been better. The other man... He said I shouldn't talk too much.
DIALOGUE AFTER: HighRise: He told you right, H2. You'll need a real name, and a new face, but we'll get to that.

RESPONSE TEXT: What? What is that?
Why are they attacking us?
So violent.
Mr. Stockton said I shouldn't say anything.
But thank you. Thank all of you.
This whole... place... is like a bad dream.
Who are you? Stay back.
The doc said I got some sort of contagious disease or something. I'm under quarantine.
I don't know what I got. I just woke up here. Wherever here is.
As soon as the doctor says it's safe, I'm leaving.
